arabic_text: لَكُمۡ فِيهَا مَنَٰفِعُ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٖ مُّسَمّٗى ثُمَّ مَحِلُّهَآ إِلَى ٱلۡبَيۡتِ ٱلۡعَتِيقِ
translation: (33) For you therein [i.e., the animals marked for sacrifice] are benefits for a specified term;[926] then their place of sacrifice is at the ancient House.[927]
footnotes:
[926]- i.e., they may be milked or ridden (in the case of camels) before the time of slaughter.
[927]- i.e., within the boundaries of the Ḥaram, which includes Minā.
